official-title.#text:
To provide for transparency and reporting related to
		  direct and indirect costs incurred by the Bonneville Power Administration, the
		  Western Area Power Administration, the Southwestern Power Administration, and
		  the Southeastern Power Administration related to compliance with any Federal
		  environmental laws impacting the conservation of fish and wildlife, and for
		  other purposes.

sponsor.#tail:
introduced
			 the following bill; which was referred to the

short-title.#text:
Environmental Compliance Cost Transparency Act of
			 2013

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall include in monthly billings sent to each of their
			 power customers information estimating and reporting the costs of the
			 customer’s share of the direct and indirect costs incurred by the
			 administration related to compliance with any Federal environmental laws
			 impacting the conservation of fish and wildlife considered by the Administrator
			 concerned, at that Administrator’s sole discretion after consultation with
			 consumers, to be relevant.

text.#text:
The Administrators
			 of each of the

header.#text:
Information
			 included in monthly billing to power customers

text.#text:
Direct costs reported under this section shall include
			 Federal agency obligations related to costs of studies; capital, operation,
			 maintenance, and replacement costs; and staffing costs.

Indirect costs reported under this section shall include
			 foregone generation and replacement power costs, including the net costs of any
			 transmission.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
and the head of any other affected
			 Federal agency shall assist the Administrators with the identification of the
			 costs.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Commissioner of the Bureau of Reclamation

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Environmental Compliance Cost Transparency Act of 2013/s:2/ss:a

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
and other
			 affected Federal agencies, shall provide an annual report to the appropriate
			 committees of the

estimating the total
			 of the direct and indirect costs incurred by the administration related to
			 compliance with any Federal environmental laws impacting the conservation of
			 fish and wildlife, the sources of replacement power, and costs related to
			 integrating wind energy resources considered by the Administrator concerned, at
			 that Administrator’s sole discretion after consultation with consumers, to be
			 relevant.

text.#text:

			 later than January 30 of each year, each of the Administrators referred to in
